groBot.entity

Class Lights

  • java.lang.Object
    • groBot.entity.Lights

  • public class Lights
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the light bulb sockets and their timings There are on and off times for the lights that we will send to the Microcontroller to switch power Different sets of lights are determined by the int lightPins (see member documentation)
    Author:
    conangammel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Long id
      Objectify ID
      private int lightPins
      Numerical representation of the two light ports.
      private int offTime
      Time the lights turn off.
      private int onTime
      Time the lights turn on.
      private long sched_id
      ID of the Schedule that the lights belong to

    • Field Detail

      • id

        private java.lang.Long id
        Objectify ID

      • lightPins

        private int lightPins
        Numerical representation of the two light ports. 00 maps to both off. 01 maps to pin1 off and pin2 on. 02 maps to pin1 on and pin2 off. 03 maps to both pins on.

      • offTime

        private int offTime
        Time the lights turn off. In military time

      • onTime

        private int onTime
        Time the lights turn on. In military time

      • sched_id

        private long sched_id
        ID of the Schedule that the lights belong to
        See Also:
        Schedule

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lights

        public Lights()
        Default constructor for Objectify (required for storing).

      • Lights

        protected Lights(int onT,
      int offT,
      java.lang.Boolean pin1,
      java.lang.Boolean pin2)
        Constructor used by this package only. This is used by the addNewScheduleServlet.
        Parameters:
        onT - - on time of the lights
        offT - - off time of the lights
        pin1 - - pin1 boolean true=on false=off
        pin2 - - pin2 boolean true=on false=off

    • Method Detail

      • convertBooleantoInt

        private int convertBooleantoInt(java.lang.Boolean pin1,
                      java.lang.Boolean pin2)
        This method takes in the light pin booleans and converts it to an integer.
        Parameters:
        pin1 - - pin1 boolean true=on false=off
        pin2 - - pin2 boolean true=on false=off
        Returns:
        Integer - 00 for both off. 01 for pin1 off and pin2 on. 02 for pin1 on and pin2 off. 03 for both pins on.

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Return the Objectify ID.
        Returns:
        long - Objectofy ID

      • getLightPins

        public int getLightPins()
        Returns the integer representing the light pins.
        Returns:
        Which pins are on according to: 00 for both off. 01 for pin1 off and pin2 on. 02 for pin1 on and pin2 off. 03 for both pins on.

      • getOffTime

        public int getOffTime()
        Return the time the lights should turn off.
        Returns:
        int - the time the lights should turn off (in military time)

      • getOnTime

        public int getOnTime()
        Return the time the lights should turn on.
        Returns:
        int - the time the lights should turn on (in military time)

        public void setID()
        Set the Objectify ID.
